results.title: Software Platform Django
results.description:
Crowdbotics is on a mission to democratize the software development process by providing entrepreneurs, product managers, and technical teams with the tools to build applications with zero to minimal coding. Embedded in our DNA are the following beliefs and values:

  • open systems empower our customers to build future-proof businesses on our platform
  • open architectures enable customers to leverage the ‚Äúbest-of-breed‚Äù technologies for their business and our platform should support and embrace them

  • talent is global and we will strive to make it accessible to our customers with minimal effort.We are looking for like-minded people who believe in our mission, and share our vision of a world where anyone can build software - at scale.

Our backend API and services power the dashboard that our customers use to create applications with minimal coding, request and manage resources for their application, initiate and monitor application development projects, and manage all aspects of their application lifecycle.

  • At least 3 years experience with python.

  • Experience developing REST APIs.
  • Proficiency with git.
  • An understanding of REST API integration.
  • Experience working with remote teams is a plus.
  • Experience managing apps, keys, and certificates in Google Play and Apple App Store is a plus.

Although this position is remote, you will need to be available at least 6 hours during 9:00AM - 5:00PM US Pacific Time.

Bonus:

results.description:
About Resilia

Resilia is a fast-growing, venture-backed, mission-driven SaaS startup powering a digital transformation in the nonprofit sector. Our mission is to strengthen nonprofit capacity and help grantors scale impact through data-driven technology solutions. Resilia‚Äôs three SaaS-based products help nonprofits achieve tax-exempt status, and build capacity in pursuit of becoming high performing organizations while enabling corporations and foundations to support nonprofits beyond grant awards. As a company, Resilia was named 2022 Best Tech Startup in New Orleans, Rising Star on the 2020 Forbes Cloud 100 list, VentureBeat's Companies to Watch list and Sevetri Wilson, Resilia‚Äôs Founder and CEO, has been recognized in Inc Magazine's 100 Women Building America's Most Innovative Companies and Pitchbook's top Black Tech Leaders list. The company recently closed a historic Series B raise: the $35 million round will fuel growth and impact for the company‚Äôs 15,000+ nonprofit users, and marks the largest single VC raise ever by a solo Black female-founded tech company. For more information visit resilia.com.

We are open to fully remote candidates who are available for an Eastern Time Zone schedule. This role may require occasional travel, including to Resilia‚Äôs New York and New Orleans offices. #LI-REMOTE

About the Role

As a pivotal member of Resilia‚Äôs Engineering leadership, the Engineering Manager will provide valuable career guidance and mentorship to our growing engineering team and manage the delivery of high impact product feature launches on our platform all while leveraging our cutting-edge tech stack.

Cross-team collaboration is the backbone of our success at Resilia. The Engineering Manager will work closely with the Product and Design teams to understand the short and long term Product strategy and use that to inform capacity planning, future hiring needs and improvements to processes, practices and architecture. You would bring a collaborative approach to problem solving, providing high level coaching and guidance to the Engineering team on complex technical challenges. Your empathetic approach in team management will focus on individual growth while facilitating alignment with team and company goals.

The ideal candidate has experience managing a team of engineers and collaborating with direct reports to build and formalize career paths and set them up for success. You are comfortable leading technology discussions and use your experience with a variety of tools and technologies to steer the team in the direction which provides the maximum impact to our product and our users. You are able to elevate discussions around new architectures, infrastructure and tech debt at the appropriate time and have effective discussions with the Product team around prioritizing those areas as part of the product roadmap. You can navigate difficult conversations and resolve conflicts - fostering a culture of open and honest conversations.

This role has a direct impact on our nonprofit users, enabling them to utilize the true power of Resilia‚Äôs platform in a seamless manner and at the same time, playing a key role in helping nonprofits strengthen their operations, scale their impact, and communicate their work to their supporters and communities.

Reporting to the Director of Engineering, you will be an early and crucial contributor to Resilia‚Äôs growing Engineering team.

Tech Stack

We do not hire for expertise in any specific technology, but rather for an ability and curiosity to learn and for those who keep up to speed with the latest practices and patterns that bring a competitive advantage.

With that in mind, our current application stack consists of: Typescript node, GraphQL APIs, Typescript ReactJS single-page web applications, and design components based off of Material UI and optimized for accessibility. We leverage several cloud based platforms that power core features of our platform and our user experience (Stripe, Auth0, Mailgun, Contentful, etc). Our infrastructure is on Heroku and we practice continuous testing and deployment, often deploying several times a day.

Qualifications
  • 2+ years of experience managing an engineering team of 3-4 engineers
  • Experience in hiring, onboarding and coaching engineers
  • 5+ years of software development experience
  • Experience in multiple languages, backend and frontend frameworks
  • Advanced API design and implementation skills
  • Advanced database design and migrations skills
  • Experience in utilizing goal setting frameworks like OKRs to help align team and individual goals to company goals preferred
  • Infrastructure, security, and SRE experience or exposure a plus
About You
  • Product and customer-oriented approach to problem-solving
  • Well-developed communication skills, ability to explain complex problems, and to share and visualize findings with stakeholders in product, marketing, revenue operations, and senior leadership teams
  • Action-oriented, entrepreneurial, flexible, and comfortable with ambiguity and managing priorities
  • Passion, humility, humor, integrity, positive attitude, mission-driven and self-directed
  • Committed to supporting a diverse, inclusive, and collaborative work environment
Compensation & Benefits

Why Resilia? Resilia powers the people changing the world.

Resilia is an inclusive and welcoming workplace where our team thrives on collaboration, creativity, innovation, and fun. We are proud to offer a competitive salary commensurate with experience and excellent benefits including unlimited PTO, medical, dental, vision, and life insurance, a 401k program, mental health support, a healthcare advocate, short-term disability, and commuter benefits, with potential for an equity stake in a fast-growing company.

Volta Trucks, a hypergrowth European Electric Truck Manufacturer, is looking for a Electrical Systems Support Engineer to join our Electrical and Powertrain team. This is a travelling role with a requirement to provide onsite support inside and outside the UK.

This is a unique opportunity to join an ambitious scale-up where you will have the opportunity to contribute to the manufacturing strategy for a forward thinking, rapidly expanding business. results.title: Sales Rep for Residential Leasing Platform
results.description:
ShowMojo streamlines the residential rental process, and vastly improves the leasing experience for property managers and renters alike. Our company is growing rapidly, with customers in all 50 states. To learn more about us visit: showmojo.com

Values

ShowMojo strives to connect individuals that closely align with our values:

  • Do you have the confidence to exchange opinions in an open environment with respectful candor?
  • Are you self-directed and able to proactively solve problems?
  • Do you pride yourself on showing up prepared and feel personal responsibility to see your accountabilities through to completion?

If this resonates with your personal values, we would like to have a career discussion with you.

Overview

We are looking for US based sales professionals who are self-motivated, have positive energy, and bring enthusiasm into the role. Our sales team members enjoy working independently, but also interact in healthy team-based collaboration.

ShowMojo's sales team uses an online approach to land business-to-business sales. This starts with prospecting and warming up leads to build a funnel of interested prospects, progresses into online demos and closing calls to get to the sale, and finishes off with follow-up calls to ensure the sale is onboarded and happy.

Activities throughout the week can vary. Some days could have a heavy focus on dialing and prospecting to refresh your pipeline. Other days could be filled with online demos, where you need to present and demonstrate sometimes complicated concepts (related to leasing automation and emerging leasing best practices) in simple, user-friendly terms. Other days could be closing calls and building your referral chain.

Some travel is required. You'll be expected to attend up to a dozen trade shows and industry-related events each year. Property management or real estate experience -- while helpful -- is not required for this position. We will help you get up to speed on the domain.

Our company is fully remote. We hire based on technical self-reliance. You should be comfortable (and even excited) working with and learning about current technologies.

Requirements

  • Have meaningful experience with cold calling and closing calls. Solid and professional written communication skills.
  • Ability to professionally and personably communicate with business owners and critical stakeholders.
  • Have experience presenting with online tools like Zoom, Join.me or Webex.
  • Self-manage your prospecting and sales activities -- calling, emailing and demoing throughout the day -- in order to hit daily, weekly and monthly targets.
  • Maintain new and existing customer connections and activities within our CRM.
  • Have a quiet office (home or elsewhere) with a strong internet connection and a newer computer.

Benefits

This is a salaried position, including both base and commission. The advertised compensation range combines both salary and commission.

Available benefits include health insurance, dental, vision, and 401k.

We strive to automate most of the mundane parts of QA testing, and currently use a mix of manual and automated testing.¬†

¬†

Collaborating with the engineering team in releasing exciting new features, and investigating bugs for the customer support team are our main priorities. One of the best parts of my job is building trusting relationships with our engineers, and feeling like I have a direct impact on making our product not only usable for our customers but beloved by them!

¬†

You might be the perfect match for our team if:

  • You are detail-oriented and are an excellent communicator - someone who is committed to creating great collaborations with engineers and customer service

  • You are terrific at time management and taking initiative, being able to think outside of the box to find solutions

  • You can scale up your knowledge of the Ashby product systematically and document workflows for easily reproducible QA. You love to learn!

  • You are passionate about the customer experience and ensuring it‚Äôs constantly exceeding expectations.

Bonus

  • You have experience working with a complex and technical product

  • You are familiar with automation and creating automated tests

  • You can use SQL and similarly advanced methods for debugging

¬†

What We‚Äôre Building

At Ashby, we‚Äôre improving the productivity of working professionals (starting with talent teams) with intelligent and powerful software. We put a lot of effort into designing products that are approachable to beginners but mastered and extended by power users. In many ways, spreadsheets set the bar here.

¬†

We have many customers who love us, and we have great investors like YCombinator, Elad Gil, and Lachy Groom. I‚Äôll share more once we meet.

¬†

Our Culture

Our team culture is motivated by Abhik and Benji‚Äôs (our co-founders) belief that a small talented team, given the right environment, can build high-quality software fast (and work regular hours!).

¬†

Collaboration is Natural, Communication is Deliberate

Our team consists of lifelong learners who are humble and kind (meet them here!). These attributes create an environment where collaboration happens naturally (we filter for it in interviews). We combine this with research, prototyping, and written proposals to see around corners and get feedback from the team across time zones. Focus time is sacred, and individual contributors have less than 2 hours of meetings per week (Abhik wrote about it here).¬†

¬†

Give Ownership & Autonomy

Our culture reflects the experience of having a deep understanding of the end-user and the business and ownership over the solution: individual contributors, including engineers, own projects end-to-end, from speaking with users to writing product specs to UX design. These are skills that we often don‚Äôt get to practice, and, at Ashby, we provide mentorship to grow them and help from the team where you want it.¬†

¬†

Put Effort into Diversity¬†

Diverse teams drive innovation and better outcomes. Having built my career as a woman in non-diverse fields, I am fully invested in making sure Ashby creates opportunities for individuals from underrepresented groups.

¬†

Today, 39% of Ashby identifies as women or non-binary, 10% from underrepresented ethnic groups in tech. It‚Äôs not great, and we are taking conscious steps to improve, like sourcing diverse candidates, providing generous paid family leave, and more.

¬†

Interview Process

At Ashby, our team and interview process want to help you show your best self. We‚Äôll dive into past projects and get an idea of your approach to QA by having you record a QA process for part of our product. Our interview process is three rounds:

¬†

  • 45-minute introduction call

  • A take-home assignment where you will document a QA workflow (4 hours max)

  • A meeting with a cofounder (30 minutes)

  • A virtual on-site of 2 hours and 30 minutes (can be split across two days)

¬†

Your hiring manager will be your main point of contact and prep you for interviews. You can get a product demo as early as the introductory call. During the interview process, you‚Äôll meet a co-founder plus 4 to 6 people in engineering (with 15 minutes in each interview to ask them questions). If we don‚Äôt give an offer, we‚Äôll provide feedback!

¬†

Benefits

  • Competitive salary and equity.

  • 10-year exercise window for stock options. You shouldn‚Äôt feel pressure to purchase stock options if you leave Ashby ‚Äîdo it when you feel financially comfortable.

  • Unlimited PTO with four weeks recommended per year. Expect ‚ÄúVacation?‚Äù in our one-on-one agenda until you start taking it üòÖ.

  • Twelve weeks of fully paid family leave in the US. We plan to expand this to employees in other countries as situations arise.

  • Generous equipment, software, and office furniture budget. Get what you need to be happy and productive!

  • $100/month education budget with more expensive items (like conferences) covered with manager approval.

  • If you‚Äôre in the US, top-notch health insurance for you and your dependents with all premiums covered by us.

¬†

Ashby‚Äôs success hinges on hiring great people and creating an environment where we can be happy, feel challenged, and do our best work. We‚Äôre being deliberate about building that environment from the ground up. I hope that excites you enough to apply.




Ashby provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce and welcome people from all backgrounds, experiences, perspectives, and abilities.
